content: tula s mitts by tiffany joy haworth these mitts are warm and basic with a twist - a corded back lace edging lends them a delicate air they were inspired by the character tula cowan from maria v snyder s fire study also referenced in storm glass and sea glass she was a young woman who crafted beautiful glass animals sizes and materials list size xs/s and m/l hook s us g/6 4 mm yarn joy of life merino 100% superwash merino 400 yds/100 g skein/ball colors & approx yardage beach combing 140 175 yds notions yarn needle gauge 20 sts and 11 row = 4 /10 cm in alternate double_crochet see below skill level intermediate notes gauge swatch please work gauge swatch in alternate double_crochet see below stitches used slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet alternate double_crochet adc alternate triple crochet atrc corded ridge stitch crs abbreviations used stitch es st / sts back loop only blo front loop only flo special stitches alternate double_crochet adc yo insert hook in work yo pull through work yo pull through 1 loop yo pull through remaining 3 loops alternate triple crochet atrc double yo insert hook in work yo pull through work yo pull through 1 loop yo pull through 3 loops yo pull through remaining 2 loops corded ridge stitch crs after a right side row do not turn with hook facing downwards insert the hook back into the next stitch to the right hook yarn and pull through turn hook and finish single_crochet as normal pattern instructions left mitt base chain chain 33 38 row 1 skip 3 chains adc in next 12 14 chains atrc in next 18 chains 21 30 35 sts row 2 chain 3 and turn adc flo across row 3-5 6 repeat row 2 3x 4x row 6 xs/s size only -
